wikipedia_page.main: George William James Chandos Brudenell-Bruce, 6th Marquess of Ailesbury,  (21 May 1873 – 4 August 1961), styled Earl of Cardigan between 1894 and 1911, was a British soldier. According to his hand-written memoirs, available at the Wiltshire and Swindon History Centre, he went by the name Chandos.

response: He was the son of George Brudenell-Bruce, 6th Marquess of Ailesbury, and Caroline Sydney Anne Madden. He was educated at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford.
